description:
CancerHallmarks.com is an interactive web tool that analyzes gene lists based on the ten canonical hallmarks of cancer. It integrates 6,763 hallmark-associated genes (core set: 1,574) from multiple databases and offers enrichment analysis with clear bar and distribution plots.

Key features:

Upload any gene set and identify overrepresented cancer hallmarks

Choose full or core gene sets for focused analysis

Export results and link to survival, therapy, diagnostics, and methylation data via integrated KM-plotter, ROC-plotter, TNM-plotter, and EpigenPlot tools

It helps place gene lists into a cancer-specific biological context, supporting functional insights and biomarker discovery.
